law.catch_line: There is a Housing Finance Review Committee....

text.section: There is a Housing Finance Review Committee.

The Housing Finance Review Committee consists of seven members appointed by the Governor on recommendation of the Secretary as follows:
three employees of the Department, one of whom may be the Secretary;
one employee of the Executive Branch of State government who is not employed by the Department; and
three members of the public.

section.section: The term of a public member is 4 years and begins on July 1.
At the end of a term, a public member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A public member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

The Housing Finance Review Committee shall review and make recommendations to the Secretary about:
specific loan requests or categories of loan requests; and
the investment and project financing policies of the Administration.
The Secretary may approve a specific loan request without a recommendation of the Housing Finance Review Committee if the request requires urgent action.
